Pre-Game Insights: Shimron Hetmyer returns to the national team, strengthening the batting order of the Caribbean team.
The Caribbean team will face a tough challenge from England, who will be led by Liam Livingstone due to Jos Buttler's injury.
West Indies head coach Darren Sammy expressed excitement about the upcoming ODI series, expecting tough competition from England.
17-year-old Jewel Andrew impressed on the Sri Lanka tour and will infuse new energy into the team along with the experienced players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The first ODI between West Indies and England will be played in Antigua on Thursday.
The series will be played over three matches, with the first match at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium.
West Indies defeated England 2-1 in the series last year and will try to repeat the same performance.
Others: The West Indies squad includes Shai Hope (Captain), Jewel Andrew, Casey Carty, Roston Chase, Matthew Forde, Shimron Hetmyer, Alzari Joseph, Shamar Joseph, Brandon King, Evin Lewis, Gudakesh Moti, Sherfane Rutherford, Jayden Seals, Romario Shepherd, and Hayden Walsh Jr.
